gurmukhi: ਰਜ ਤਮ ਸਤ ਕਾਮ ਕ੍ਰੋਧ ਲੋਭ ਮੋਹ ਹੰਕਾਰ ਹਾਰਿ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਬਾਨ ਕ੍ਰਾਂਤਿ ਨਿਹਕ੍ਰਾਂਤਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Raj Tam Sat Kaam Krodh Lobh Moh Hankaara , Haari Gur Giaan Baan Kraanti Nihakraanti Hai ?
translation: By virtue of initiation by the Guru and practicing of meditation on the Lord's name, all the traits of maya (Raja, Sato, Tamo) and vices like lust, anger, avarice, attachment and pride are defeated. Their influence also becomes negligible.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮ ਨਿਹਕਾਮ ਨਿਹਕਰਮ ਕਰਮ ਗਤਿ ਅਾਸਾ ਕੈ ਨਿਰਾਸ ਭੲੇ ਭ੍ਰਾਤ ਨਿਹਭ੍ਰਾਂਤਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Kaam Nihakaam Nihakaram Karam Gati , Aasaa Kai Niraas Bhaay Bhraat Nihabhraanti Hai ?
translation: With the acquisition of Guru's knowledge, a Guru-oriented person loses attachment with all desires, and all his actions become benevolent. All his worldly desires end and his wandering stops.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਵਾਦ ਨਿਹਸ੍ਵਾਦੁ ਅਰੁ ਬਾਦ ਨਿਹਬਾਦ ਭੲੇ ਅਸਪ੍ਰੇਹ ਨਿਸਪ੍ਰੇਹ ਗੇਹ ਦੇਹ ਪਾਂਤਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Svaad Nihasvaadu Aru Baad Nihabaad Bhaay , Asaprayh Nisaprayh Gayh Dayh Paanti Hai ?
translation: A Guru-oriented person becomes free of all attachments and relishments by virtue of Guru's teachings. Engrossed in Naam Simran, he does not indulge in other debates and arguments. He becomes totally desireless and contended. His attachment with worldly at

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਰਸ ਬਿਸਮ ਬਿਦੇਹ ਸਿਖ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮੈ ੳੁਦਾਸ ਬਾਸ ੲੇਕਾਕੀ ੲਿਕਾਂਤਿ ਹੈ ||੨੭੨||
transliteration: Gurmukhi Praym Ras Bisam Bidayh Sikha , Maaiaa Mai Udaas Baas Aykaakee Ikaanti Hai ?272?
translation: By virtues of Naam Simran, a follower of Guru's teachings become free of all his body needs. He remains in a state of . trance and unsullied in maya. He is ever engrossed in the memory of the Lord. (272)
